column1: The word aen is seen in the phrase of the Kings Letter
This is translated as "who ought to be called Fullwise" p.126 (referring to Samwise Gamgee).

column2: which is future tense and means "they will name". It is not known if aen can follow verbs of other tenses. Likewise
column3: it is not known if aen is the pronoun ("they should name him Fullwiise")
column4: a marker of the passive voice ("He should be called Fullwise")
column5: or an optative marker which expresses a wish ("Whom instead should call Fullwise").
